definition: to stock up/to lay in supplies/to hoard (for speculation)/to corner the market in sth

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing

sentences.english: She expected a shortage of dried fruit so she laid in a large supply.
sentences.chinese: 她預期果脯會有短缺，所以囤積了一大批。

sentences.english: A disposophobic has a delusional regard for the value of the things he hoards.
sentences.chinese: 囤積癖者對他囤積物的價值都有一種不切實際的預估。

sentences.english: A disposophobic has a delusional regard for the value of the things he hoards.
sentences.chinese: 囤積癖者對他囤積物的價值都有一種不切實際的預估。

sentences.english: In our hands is placed a power greater than their hoarded gold.
sentences.chinese: 在我們手中的權力是放在大於囤積黃金。

sentences.english: India, Russia, China, and Persian Gulf countries are all accumulating gold.
sentences.chinese: 印度，俄羅斯，以及波斯灣國家都在囤積黃金。

sentences.english: Banks, too, have been increasing the pace at which they are hoarding cash.
sentences.chinese: 銀行業一直在加快步伐囤積現金。

sentences.english: The wealthy hoard the sweeter dreams.
sentences.chinese: 富有者囤積了更甜美的夢想。

sentences.english: It's even reported that speculators are hoarding a large number of properties to fuel price rises.
sentences.chinese: 甚至有報道說炒房者囤積大量房源以擡高價格。

sentences.english: China’s leaders promise to hunt down and punish hoarders and speculators.
sentences.chinese: 中國領導人承諾嚴查和懲罰囤積居奇和投機倒把分子。

sentences.english: The price hike in garlic was mainly caused by hoarding and profiteering.
sentences.chinese: 大蒜價格的瘋漲主要是由一些人的囤積居奇引起的。

sentences.english: The first daughter responds to charges of hoarding taxpayer nickels.
sentences.chinese: 美國第一女兒迴應對她囤積納稅人銅板的指控。

sentences.english: His land is adjacent to the biggest vegetable wasteland in the county.
sentences.chinese: 他的土地毗鄰縣上最大的蔬菜廢棄物囤積地。

sentences.english: Ahermit thrush gulps down a wild berry to bulk up on antioxidants.
sentences.chinese: 一隻鶇吞下野生的漿果來囤積抗氧化劑。

sentences.english: It is a fight between hoarders and non-hoarders.
sentences.chinese: 這是一場囤積者和非囤積者之間的戰役。

sentences.english: It is a fight between hoarders and non-hoarders.
sentences.chinese: 這是一場囤積者和非囤積者之間的戰役。

sentences.english: That last wishes as merely commandeer to hoard up you away from the action.
sentences.chinese: 僅僅徵用囤積了您從行動離開這最後的願望。

definition: to pile up/to accumulate without being dealt with
within the body/in vivo (vs in vitro)/internal to
to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
hot money, money flowing from one currency to another in the hope of quick profit
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to put on weight/to get fat
